unnormalised: ## Automotive Buzz: New Wheels on Indian Roads!
normalised: Folks, get ready to rev your engines! This week's been a whirlwind of new vehicle launches. First up, Mahindra unveiled its souped-up Thar two point zero, promising even more off-roading thrills near Ladakh. They're calling it the "Mountain King" - desi, right?

unnormalised: Folks, get ready to rev your engines! This week's been a whirlwind of new vehicle launches. First up, Mahindra unveiled its souped-up Thar 2.0, promising even more off-roading thrills near Ladakh. They're calling it the "Mountain King" - desi, right?
normalised: Then, Maruti Suzuki launched the 'Alto eight hundred City Rider' edition, targeting young professionals in Mumbai. Expect tight parking made easy! Starting price is apparently around rupees four point five lakhs.

unnormalised: Then, Maruti Suzuki launched the 'Alto 800 City Rider' edition, targeting young professionals in Mumbai. Expect tight parking made easy! Starting price is apparently around Rs. 4.5 lakhs.
normalised: But wait, there's more! Tata Motors showcased a sneak peek of their upcoming electric S U V, codenamed "Project Vidyut", at the Auto Expo in Greater Noida. Doctor Sharma from A R A I was visibly impressed with its projected range of five hundred kilometer! The spacious interiors boast a panoramic sunroof and a touchscreen the size of a small building (okay, maybe not that big, but close!).

unnormalised: But wait, there's more! Tata Motors showcased a sneak peek of their upcoming electric SUV, codenamed "Project Vidyut", at the Auto Expo in Greater Noida. Dr. Sharma from ARAI was visibly impressed with its projected range of 500 km! The spacious interiors boast a panoramic sunroof and a touchscreen the size of a small building (okay, maybe not THAT big, but close!).
normalised: Finally, Hero MotoCorp is rumoured to be launching a new scooter with a massive storage area of two hundred square feet - perfect for carrying all those Diwali mithai boxes! Stay tuned for updates!

unnormalised: Finally, Hero MotoCorp is rumoured to be launching a new scooter with a massive storage area of 200 sq ft - perfect for carrying all those Diwali mithai boxes! Stay tuned for updates!
